newsitem.title: UK: UK B/socs net new approvals s/a 3.643 bln in Aug.
newsitem.headline: UK B/socs net new approvals s/a 3.643 bln in Aug.

text.p: The UK Building Societies Association (BSA) released the following, seasonally adjusted, data on lending -
MORTGAGE ADVANCES AND NEW APPROVALS TO LEND (in 1000s)
NOTES - approval = borrower accepts offer of advance; advance = actual loan, on average some 10 wks after commitment; advances tend to reflect new approvals made 2 or 3 mths ago.

BSA director-general Adrian Coles said that allowing for the fact that National & Provincial ceased to be a building society in early August, the latest lending figures represented further positive news for the housing market.

"Although gross advances, at 3.8 billion stg in August, were seven percent lower than in July, this decline can be more than fully accounted for by National & Provincial's departure and the normal downturn in activity during the holiday season," he said.

On a seasonally adjusted basis, gross advances were down only a little on July, signalling the strongest performance since 1990. The year-on-year rise in principal repayments continued its pattern of lagging behind that of gross advances.
"This suggests that the pace of remortgage activity may be slowing as discounts and cashbacks are pared back, in turn contributing to the more positive net advance figures."

"These figures provide the clearest indication that the housing market is returning to health, with the stronger than expected levels of lending over the summer period pointing to further improvements for the rest of the year," Coles added.
